divs: Sighting DetailsI was right behind Norcross City Hall (off Lawrenceville Street), and glanced up towards the sky when I saw a black sphere floating slowly just under the cloud layer. At first, I thought it was just a balloon. Then I noticed it was floating towards the left (west, I believe) and the clouds were moving in the opposite direction (right, or east). Therefore it was going against the wind current. As I watched, the sun temporarily shone off the object and it seemed to gleam, making it appear somewhat metallic. Then the object stopped completely and hovered for about a minute. Then it changed direction and started to float with the clouds (to the east). Then it stopped again and hovered, and looked like it was moving very quickly back and forth. Then it began moving back to the left and getting higher (and smaller). I watched for almost 20 minutes, wishing I had some binoculars with me or a high quality camera. It finally got so small it just disappeared.
